l:dependency.name: Joda time
l:dependency.l:description: Date and time library to replace JDK date handling

l:dependency.name: Jackson-datatype-json.org
l:dependency.l:description: Support for datatypes of "org.json" JSON library (see http://json.org/java), mainly to make it easier to upgrade code to Jackson, using automated conversions.

l:dependency.name: json-schema-validator
l:dependency.l:description: A Java implementation of the JSON Schema specification

l:dependency.name: JSON in Java
l:dependency.l:description:
JSON is a light-weight, language independent, data interchange format. See http://www.JSON.org/
The files in this package implement JSON encoders/decoders in Java. It also includes the capability to convert between JSON and XML, HTTP headers, Cookies, and CDL.
This is a reference implementation. There is a large number of JSON packages in Java. Perhaps someday the Java community will standardize on one. Until then, choose carefully.
The license includes this restriction: "The software shall be used for good, not evil." If your conscience cannot live with that, then choose a different package.

l:dependency.name: Mozilla Rhino
l:dependency.l:description: Rhino is an open-source implementation of JavaScript written entirely in Java. It is typically embedded into Java applications to provide scripting to end users.

l:dependency.name: libphonenumber
l:dependency.l:description: Google's common Java library for parsing, formatting, storing and validating international phone numbers. Optimized for running on smartphones.
